title: What makes traditional Japanese music sound 'Japanese'? I don't mean the instruments, but the notes and scales. - Quora

response.answer_text: Japanese music usually uses a pentatonic scale, easiest managed by only using the black keys on a piano. Transpose, add a few authentically Japanese instruments if you like, so that it doesn’t sound like something played on a grand (or upright, organ, or keytar) as needed. A Yamaha piano or organ doesn’t count as “authentic”, though.
